subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: Missing Children Europe, the European Federation for Missing and Sexually Exploited Children, is a network organization in itself. It represents 31 NGOs in 27 European countries (24 EU Member States + Switzerland, Albania & Serbia), all of them active in the prevention and fight against child sexual exploitation and/or child disappearance.
relevant_communication:
.            Implementation of policies, public relations and communication activities, for example projects, events and publications (maximum 4000 caractères) 
 
•        We implement the 116 000  European network for missing children: same number/same service (Support, training, advocacy, communication and awareness raising of the 116 000 hotlines) 
•         We coordinate the European Network of Family Mediators 
•         We have developed a Missing Children memorandum to the European Institutions 
•         We collect data on missing children in Europe annually 
o    We publish the “Figures and Trends 2015” from hotlines for missing children and cross-border family mediators 
•         We publish the Missing Children Europe Annual Report 
o    We published the “SUMMIT Handbook” – Practical guidance on preventing and responding to unaccompanied children going missing  
o    We published the “SUMMIT Report” – Best practices and key challenges on interagency cooperation to safeguard unaccompanied children from going missing
